title: Software Engineer - Media Services
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, phenomenal ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there’s no telling what you could accomplish. The Apple Media Services team is looking for a dedicated, diligent and hard-working software engineer to join the growing AMS User Engagement team. Help define and build system features like Apple One subscription flows, and shared user interfaces that will delight users across all of Apple’s services and media apps on iOS, iPadOS, tvOS, watchOS, macOS and VisionOS.
description: You will develop new and improve existing parts of the shared frameworks that power all of Apple’s services products. Architect and build new APIs, and work with design to help define and implement user interfaces. As an engineer on the team, you will be contributing to all four of Apple’s major operating systems: iOS, tvOS, watchOS, macOS. and VisionOS.  Build out APIs to handle foundational features such as user authentication and purchases. You’ll have the opportunity to work alongside other multi-functional teams closely, in order to bring the best customer experiences to life.
preferred_qualifications: Object Oriented Programming, Experience with Cocoa and the iOS SDK, Familiarity with mobile application UI development, Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills, Experience in defining and building APIs, Passion for quality and attention to detail, Aptitude to independently learn new technologies
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $143,100 and $264,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.
